intro: Muscari sivrihisardaghlarense, commonly known as the Sivrihisar muscar, is a rare bulbous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped blue-violet flowers. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a unique addition to rock gardens or alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
